intro: Pyrenoglyphis pallidispina, commonly known as the pale-spined pyrenoglyphis, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, sparsely branched stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with white or pale yellow petals. The pale-spined pyrenoglyphis is of interest to botanists due to its distinct morphology and limited distribution.
